text: the UK says it will scrap the so-called
tampon tax it's a controversial subject
around the world pads and tampons are
taxed in more than 30 countries
including most US states so how much do
women pay well women have periods for
about 38 years from ages 12 to 50
Saturn's up to about 10,000 pads if that
tax is scrapped in the UK a woman could
save nearly 70 pounds in tax that's 100
US dollars over her lifetime for now the
UK still charges 5 percent tax on
sanitary products it's higher in other
countries though in Singapore the tax on
pads and tampons is 7% and in Australia
women pay 10% tax on sanitary products
and spare a thought for the millions of
women who can't access pads or tampons
at all many are forced to use things
like her eggs leaves and newspapers
